subject: Psychology
title: Willpower as a Limited Resource
description: A fast breakdown of Willpower as a Limited Resource for builders.

hook.text: By evening, after a day of decisions, you eat junk food and skip the gym. Your willpower was spent.

buildup.text: Baumeister's ego depletion theory proposed that willpower draws from a limited pool that depletes with use.

discovery.text: People who resisted cookies performed worse on puzzles afterward. Self-control seemed to drain a shared resource.

twist.text: Recent replications have challenged ego depletion. The effect may be smaller than thought, or partly about beliefs.

climax.text: Debated or not, the practical lesson holds: don't rely on willpower alone. Build systems that don't require it.

punchline.text: The best habit systems never ask willpower to show up.

quiz.question: What does ego depletion theory propose?
options: Willpower is a limited resource that depletes with use
Willpower is unlimited and never runs out
Self-control has nothing to do with habits
